intro: Mammillaria morganiana, commonly known as the Mexican snowball cactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, white to pale blue spines and spherical shape, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 centimeters and has a compact, rounded form. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or pink, appearing in late spring or early summer. Mammillaria morganiana is a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation due to its low maintenance and ornamental value.
